data.title: Contact us about a death investigation
data.meta_description: Contact details for Scottish Fatalities Investigation Unit (SFIU) hubs to request information about a death investigation.
data.text:
The Scottish Fatalities Investigation Unit (SFIU) is a specialist team in COPFS responsible for investigating deaths. SFIU investigates all sudden, suspicious, accidental and unexplained deaths. This includes the sudden, suspicious, accidental, and unexplained deaths of children.

What is an SFIU hub

If you are the nearest relative of someone who’s death is being investigated by SFIU, you can contact your SFIU hub to request information.

There are three SFIU hubs which cover the whole of Scotland. These hubs are:

SFIU North which covers Grampian, Highland and Islands, and Tayside

SFIU East which covers Central, Fife, and Lothian and Borders

SFIU West which covers Glasgow and Strathkelvin, North and South Strathclyde, and Dumfries and Galloway

Information we will need

When you contact an SFIU hub, you will be asked for some information to help identify you, the caller, and the correct deceased person.

Please be prepared to give:

Your full name

Your contact number

Name of the person who has died

Date of birth of the person who has died

If known, the following details are also helpful:

Date the person died

Where they died

PF reference number

How to contact an SFIU hub

If you are the nearest relative of someone who’s death is being investigated by SFIU, you can contact your SFIU hub to request information.

There are three SFIU hubs which cover the whole of Scotland. These hubs are:

SFIU North which covers Grampian, Highland and Islands, and Tayside

SFIU East which covers Central, Fife, and Lothian and Borders

SFIU West which covers Glasgow and Strathkelvin, North and South Strathclyde, and Dumfries and Galloway

SFIU hubs are open Monday to Thursday 9am – 5pm and Friday 9am – 4.30pm. Outwith these hours, there is an answering machine service where a message can be left.
